intro: Myrcia neofusca, commonly known as the Brazilian myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruits are small, red berries that contain seeds, and the plant is often used in traditional medicine. Myrcia neofusca plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
